description: Non Material Amendment to Planning Permission  08/12363/FUL (Redevelopment of site to provide two, four to six storey buildings connected by a glass walkway comprising  2 x A1/A2/A3 (retail/financial & professional units/restaurants & cafes) units at ground floor, 129 student rooms on first to fifth floors and amenity space; and enlarged loading bay), to vary the wording of Condition 14 (Secured Cycle Parking Store)  to state: The development is required to provide a secure cycle store containing a minimum of 32 cycle spaces in perpetuity as shown on the Bike Store Floor Plan by Sterling Temple. Cycle parking is to be surveyed on an annual basis. If findings show that more cycle parking is needed, then additional spaces must be provided to meet demand to a maximum of 68 cycle spaces.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KEYACH Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change

decision_conditions: The application is submitted under Section 96a of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and  seeks amendment to the wording of  condition 14  of planning permission, which states:"Prior to the commencement of the development full details of the secured cycle parkingstore for at least 84 bicycles shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, such facilities shall thereafter be permanently maintained and kept available for cycle parking purposes only and free from obstruction at all times."The proposed wording is, "The development is required to provide a secure cycle store containing a minimum of 32 cycle spaces in perpetuity as shown on the Bike Store Floor Plan by Sterling Temple. Cycle parking is to be surveyed on an annual basis. If findings show that more cycle parking is needed, then additional spaces must be provided to meet demand to a maximum of 68 cycle spaces."Details of the cycle store were approved and discharged under 08/12749/COND.The proposed modification is a material change to the original condition. As such, this application is refused.
